results.title: A Year of change in three children (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cognitive Development”.
It is not until 5 years old or so that children come to understand the notions of conservation of area, length and weight. This program, recorded at Nottingham primary school, examines the responses of three children to various Piagetian tests over a period of one year.

results.title: Terra firma
results.brief_description:
This cut-out animation started life as a 5-metre long conte drawing inspired by the various unseen energies that influence and create a dimension.
Original music by Steve Fraser, Dennis Phelan, Luke Von Banbergern. Animation by Julian lawrence.

results.title: Tennis basics: the volley
results.brief_description: Dennis Ralston introduces the film by demonstrating the basic volley stroke, then using animation techniques, the exact positions of each part of the body at every stage in the swing is shown.

results.title: Tennis basics: the serve
results.brief_description: The serve is demonstrated by Dennis Ralston, and then the exact positions of each part of the body at every stage in the swing is shown. The precise movements are then repeated entirely in slow motion with frequent use of “freeze frames” for clear visualisation.

results.title: Tennis basics: the forehand
results.brief_description: Dennis Ralston introduces the film by demonstrating the basic forehand stroke and encouraging students to feel the movements as they are pictured. Animation shows the exact positions of each part of the body at every stage of the swing.

results.title: Tennis basics: the backhand
results.brief_description: American tennis professional Dennis Ralston demonstrates the backhand stroke. Simple animated figures are used to show the basic positions of the arms, legs, body and head during each phase of the swing. Viewer participation is also included.

results.title: Tennessee volunteers
results.brief_description: A project was sponsored by the University of Tennessee to build a children’s playground with the help of the community. In this way, building costs were low, and children involved gained more respect for the equipment, having helped to build it. Members of the community brought their own tools and gave their time, whilst local businesses donated equipment and the use of machinery.

results.title: Ten commandments of love
results.brief_description: A photographic still image of two people in an impassioned embrace on an ocean pier. Harvey and the Moonglows start singing ‘The ten commandments of love’ to a background of changing color.

results.title: Ten bob in winter
results.creator_credit: Lloyd Reckford and British Film Institute Experimental Film Fund
results.brief_description: Unemployed, a young coloured man living in London borrows ten shillings to see him through until he gets a job. He has no luck at the Employment Exchange, and to add to his troubles, he is `touched’ by an out-of-work fellow countryman who needs ten shillings to redeem his guitar from the pawnbroker so that he can play at a dance. While the musician is in the shop, the young man meets a rather snobbish well-off friend from whom he tries to conceal his position - a humorous position well exploited. Sharp evocation of its time - duffel coats and modern jazz score by the Joe Harriot Quintet.
